title: childhood's end
description: The show begins under the lights, everything proper, classical, rehearsed. Yet even in the opening chords, a weight hangs in the air — an ending before anything has started.

title: please don't wake me up
description: Order softens. The strings blur at the edges, rhythm hums under the floor, and a sax drifts through like a half-remembered dream. The hall flickers between waking and sleep.

title: the pit goes rogue
description: The score lies open, ignored. Players twist their instruments into new shapes — wood tapped, strings scraped, brass bent. A rebellion of sound, pulling free from the page.

title: la última quedada del verano
description: The music slows as the season turns. The last gathering carries its glow, but the sweetness hides something darker — the end of summer, and the quiet ache of knowing it’s gone.

title: hurry, or we'll miss the train
description: The quiet breaks. Percussion strikes like steel, whistles cut the air, everything rushing forward at once. It’s the sound of running without time to look back.

title: the last straw
description: The orchestra stomps in unison — blunt, short, absolute. The moment defiance hardens into action.

title: the great escape
description: Every section at full force, colliding, tearing, refusing to yield. The hall shakes with a struggle vast enough to split the walls.

title: thaw
description: Order returns, cold and square. The lesson repeats, lines drilled without imagination. But cracks open in the surface, and rebellion leaks back through, soft and unstoppable.

title: play it like we're alone
description: The hall empties. What remains is smaller, close, unguarded — sound carried quietly, as if the whole journey was only ever meant to end here.
